revised_title: Morphological Analysis of a Trypanosome from a Sleeping Sickness Case and the Possibility of a New Species
tldr: The authors investigate the morphology of a trypanosome from a sleeping sickness case and discover unique features, such as the presence of a nucleus at the posterior end, which may indicate a new species. They also discuss the strain's resistance to atoxyl and its virulence to rats and guinea-pigs.
